player

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • player.Player
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CPUPlayer, HumanPlayer

    public abstract class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing the player, which can be Human or CPU player

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean isHuman
      Is this player a human player or a computer player? True if it is a human player, false otherwise

    • Constructor Summary

      Player()

      abstract void makeMove(Unit unitToMove, GameBoardHex tile)
      Move the Unit 'unitToMove' from its current tile to the tile 'tile'.
      abstract void resetAfterRound()

    • Method Detail

      • makeMove

        public abstract void makeMove(Unit unitToMove,
                              GameBoardHex tile)
        Move the Unit 'unitToMove' from its current tile to the tile 'tile'.
        Parameters:
        unitToMove - A Unit who's turn it currently is.
        tile - A tile to move towards.

      • fireUpon

        public abstract void fireUpon(Unit unitToFire,
                              GameBoardHex tile)
        Fire upon the GameBoardHex 'tile' with the Unit 'unitToFire'.
        Parameters:
        unitToFire - A Unit who's turn it currently is.
        tile - A tile to fire at.

      • getUnits

        public abstract java.util.ArrayList<Unit> getUnits()
        Get a list of this Player's Units. The units should be ordered in the ArrayList as Scout, Sniper, and then Tank.
        Returns:
        This Player's Units

      • resetAfterRound

        public abstract void resetAfterRound()
        Re-assign movement and firing flags to this player's Units.

      • isHuman

        public boolean isHuman()
        Is this a human player or a computer player?
        Returns:
        true if it is a human player, false otherwise.
